In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the code in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = "$word"
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)  # add the last line
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```

You can use this function to wrap a string into lines of maximum `text_width` characters. For example:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

This will output:

```julia
"Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, 
consectetur adipiscing elit. 
Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt 
ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
```
